1.title: Audit and Assurance Policy and Procedures
1.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain audit and assurance policies and procedures and standards. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

2.title: Independent Assessments
2.control_description: Conduct independent audit and assurance assessments according to relevant standards at least annually.

3.title: Risk Based Planning Assessment
3.control_description: Perform independent audit and assurance assessments according to risk-based plans and policies.

4.title: Requirements Compliance
4.control_description: Verify compliance with all relevant standards, regulations, legal/contractual, and statutory requirements applicable to the audit.

5.title: Audit Management Process
5.control_description: Define and implement an Audit Management process to support audit planning, risk analysis, security control assessment, conclusion, remediation schedules, report generation, and review of past reports and supporting evidence.

6.title: Remediation
6.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain a risk-based corrective action plan to remediate audit findings, review and report remediation status to relevant stakeholders.

7.title: Application and Interface Security Policy and Procedures
7.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for application security to provide guidance to the appropriate planning, delivery and support of the organization's application security capabilities. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

8.title: Application Security Baseline Requirements
8.control_description: Establish, document and maintain baseline requirements for securing different applications.

9.title: Application Security Metrics
9.control_description: Define and implement technical and operational metrics in alignment with business objectives, security requirements, and compliance obligations.

10.title: Secure Application Design and Development
10.control_description: Define and implement a SDLC process for application design, development, deployment, and operation in accordance with security requirements defined by the organization.

11.title: Automated Application Security Testing
11.control_description: Implement a testing strategy, including criteria for acceptance of new information systems, upgrades and new versions, which provides application security assurance and maintains compliance while enabling organizational speed of delivery goals. Automate when applicable and possible.

12.title: Automated Secure Application Deployment
12.control_description: Establish and implement strategies and capabilities for secure, standardized, and compliant application deployment. Automate where possible.

13.title: Application Vulnerability Remediation
13.control_description: Define and implement a process to remediate application security vulnerabilities, automating remediation when possible.

14.title: Business Continuity Management Policy and Procedures
14.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain business continuity management and operational resilience policies and procedures. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

15.title: Risk Assessment and Impact Analysis
15.control_description: Determine the impact of business disruptions and risks to establish criteria for developing business continuity and operational resilience strategies and capabilities.

16.title: Business Continuity Strategy
16.control_description: Establish strategies to reduce the impact of, withstand, and recover from business disruptions within risk appetite.

17.title: Business Continuity Planning
17.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain a business continuity plan based on the results of the operational resilience strategies and capabilities.

18.title: Documentation
18.control_description: Develop, identify, and acquire documentation that is relevant to support the business continuity and operational resilience programs. Make the documentation available to authorized stakeholders and review periodically.

19.title: Business Continuity Exercises
19.control_description: Exercise and test business continuity and operational resilience plans at least annually or upon significant changes.

20.title: Communication
20.control_description: Establish communication with stakeholders and participants in the course of business continuity and resilience procedures.

21.title: Backup
21.control_description: Periodically backup data stored in the cloud. Ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the backup, and verify data restoration from backup for resiliency.

22.title: Disaster Response Plan
22.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain a disaster response plan to recover from natural and man-made disasters. Update the plan at least annually or upon significant changes.

23.title: Response Plan Exercise
23.control_description: Exercise the disaster response plan annually or upon significant changes, including if possible local emergency authorities.

24.title: Equipment Redundancy
24.control_description: Supplement business-critical equipment with redundant equipment independently located at a reasonable minimum distance in accordance with applicable industry standards.

25.title: Change Management Policy and Procedures
25.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for managing the risks associated with applying changes to organization assets, including application, systems, infrastructure, configuration, etc., regardless of whether the assets are managed internally or externally (i.e., outsourced). Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

26.title: Quality Testing
26.control_description: Follow a defined quality change control, approval and testing process with established baselines, testing, and release standards.

27.title: Change Management Technology
27.control_description: Manage the risks associated with applying changes to organization assets, including application, systems, infrastructure, configuration, etc., regardless of whether the assets are managed internally or externally (i.e., outsourced).

28.title: Unauthorized Change Protection
28.control_description: Restrict the unauthorized addition, removal, update, and management of organization assets.

29.title: Change Agreements
29.control_description: Include provisions limiting changes directly impacting CSCs owned environments/tenants to explicitly authorized requests within service level agreements between CSPs and CSCs.

30.title: Change Management Baseline
30.control_description: Establish change management baselines for all relevant authorized changes on organization assets.

31.title: Detection of Baseline Deviation
31.control_description: Implement detection measures with proactive notification in case of changes deviating from the established baseline.

32.title: Exception Management
32.control_description: Implement a procedure for the management of exceptions, including emergencies, in the change and configuration process. Align the procedure with the requirements of GRC-04: Policy Exception Process.

33.title: Change Restoration
33.control_description: Define and implement a process to proactively roll back changes to a previous known good state in case of errors or security concerns.

34.title: Encryption and Key Management Policy and Procedures
34.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for Cryptography, Encryption and Key Management. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

35.title: CEK Roles and Responsibilities
35.control_description: Define and implement cryptographic, encryption and key management roles and responsibilities.

36.title: Data Encryption
36.control_description: Provide cryptographic protection to data at-rest and in-transit, using cryptographic libraries certified to approved standards.

37.title: Encryption Algorithm
37.control_description: Use encryption algorithms that are appropriate for data protection, considering the classification of data, associated risks, and usability of the encryption technology.

38.title: Encryption Change Management
38.control_description: Establish a standard change management procedure, to accommodate changes from internal and external sources, for review, approval, implementation and communication of cryptographic, encryption and key management technology changes.

39.title: Encryption Change Cost Benefit Analysis
39.control_description: Manage and adopt changes to cryptography-, encryption-, and key management-related systems (including policies and procedures) that fully account for downstream effects of proposed changes, including residual risk, cost, and benefits analysis.

40.title: Encryption Risk Management
40.control_description: Establish and maintain an encryption and key management risk program that includes provisions for risk assessment, risk treatment, risk context, monitoring, and feedback.

41.title: CSC Key Management Capabiility
41.control_description: CSPs must provide the capability for CSCs to manage their own data encryption keys.

42.title: Encryption and Key Management Audit
42.control_description: Audit encryption and key management systems, policies, and processes with a frequency that is proportional to the risk exposure of the system with audit occurring preferably continuously but at least annually and after any security event(s).

43.title: Key Generation
43.control_description: Generate Cryptographic keys using industry accepted cryptographic libraries specifying the algorithm strength and the random number generator used.

44.title: Key Purpose
44.control_description: Manage cryptographic secret and private keys that are provisioned for a unique purpose.

45.title: Key Rotation
45.control_description: Rotate cryptographic keys in accordance with the calculated cryptoperiod, which includes provisions for considering the risk of information disclosure and legal and regulatory requirements.

46.title: Key Revocation
46.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to revoke and remove cryptographic keys prior to the end of its established cryptoperiod, when a key is compromised, or an entity is no longer part of the organization, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

47.title: Key Destruction
47.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to destroy keys stored outside a secure environment and revoke keys stored in Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) when they are no longer needed, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

48.title: Key Activation
48.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to create keys in a pre-activated state when they have been generated but not authorized for use, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

49.title: Key Suspension
49.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to monitor, review and approve key transitions from any state to/from suspension, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

50.title: Key Deactivation
50.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to deactivate keys at the time of their expiration date, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

51.title: Key Archival
51.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to manage archived keys in a secure repository requiring least privilege access, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

52.title: Key Compromise
52.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to use compromised keys to encrypt information only in controlled circumstance, and thereafter exclusively for decrypting data and never for encrypting data, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

53.title: Key Recovery
53.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to assess the risk to operational continuity versus the risk of the keying material and the information it protects being exposed if control of the keying material is lost, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

54.title: Key Inventory Management
54.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures in order for the key management system to track and report all cryptographic materials and changes in status, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

55.title: Off-Site Equipment Disposal Policy and Procedures
55.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for the secure disposal of equipment used outside the organization's premises. If the equipment is not physically destroyed a data destruction procedure that renders recovery of information impossible must be applied. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

56.title: Off-Site Transfer Authorization Policy and Procedures
56.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for the relocation or transfer of hardware, software, or data/information to an offsite or alternate location. The relocation or transfer request requires the written or cryptographically verifiable authorization. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

57.title: Secure Area Policy and Procedures
57.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for maintaining a safe and secure working environment in offices, rooms, and facilities. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

58.title: Secure Media Transportation Policy and Procedures
58.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for the secure transportation of physical media. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

59.title: Assets Classification
59.control_description: Classify and document the physical, and logical assets (e.g., applications) based on the organizational business risk.

60.title: Assets Cataloguing and Tracking
60.control_description: Catalogue and track all relevant physical and logical assets located at all of the CSP's sites within a secured system.

61.title: Controlled Access Points
61.control_description: Implement physical security perimeters to safeguard personnel, data, and information systems. Establish physical security perimeters between the administrative and business areas and the data storage and processing facilities areas.

62.title: Equipment Identification
62.control_description: Use equipment identification as a method for connection authentication.

63.title: Secure Area Authorization
63.control_description: Allow only authorized personnel access to secure areas, with all ingress and egress points restricted, documented, and monitored by physical access control mechanisms. Retain access control records on a periodic basis as deemed appropriate by the organization.

64.title: Surveillance System
64.control_description: Implement, maintain, and operate datacenter surveillance systems at the external perimeter and at all the ingress and egress points to detect unauthorized ingress and egress attempts.

65.title: Unauthorized Access Response Training
65.control_description: Train datacenter personnel to respond to unauthorized ingress or egress attempts.

66.title: Cabling Security
66.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures that ensure a risk-based protection of power and telecommunication cables from a threat of interception, interference or damage at all facilities, offices and rooms.

67.title: Environmental Systems
67.control_description: Implement and maintain data center environmental control systems that monitor, maintain and test for continual effectiveness the temperature and humidity conditions within accepted industry standards.

68.title: Secure Utilities
68.control_description: Secure, monitor, maintain, and test utilities services for continual effectiveness at planned intervals.

69.title: Equipment Location
69.control_description: Keep business-critical equipment away from locations subject to high probability for environmental risk events.

70.title: Security and Privacy Policy and Procedures
70.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for the classification, protection and handling of data throughout its lifecycle, and according to all applicable laws and regulations, standards, and risk level. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

71.title: Secure Disposal
71.control_description: Apply industry accepted methods for the secure disposal of data from storage media such that data is not recoverable by any forensic means.

72.title: Data Inventory
72.control_description: Create and maintain a data inventory, at least for any sensitive data and personal data.

73.title: Data Classification
73.control_description: Classify data according to its type and sensitivity level.

74.title: Data Flow Documentation
74.control_description: Create data flow documentation to identify what data is processed, stored or transmitted where. Review data flow documentation at defined intervals, at least annually, and after any change.

75.title: Data Ownership and Stewardship
75.control_description: Document ownership and stewardship of all relevant documented personal and sensitive data. Perform review at least annually.

76.title: Data Protection by Design and Default
76.control_description: Develop systems, products, and business practices based upon a principle of security by design and industry best practices.

77.title: Data Privacy by Design and Default
77.control_description: Develop systems, products, and business practices based upon a principle of privacy by design and industry best practices. Ensure that systems' privacy settings are configured by default, according to all applicable laws and regulations.

78.title: Data Protection Impact Assessment
78.control_description: Conduct a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) to evaluate the origin, nature, particularity and severity of the risks upon the processing of personal data, according to any applicable laws, regulations and industry best practices.

79.title: Sensitive Data Transfer
79.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures that ensure any transfer of personal or sensitive data is protected from unauthorized access and only processed within scope as permitted by the respective laws and regulations.

80.title: Personal Data Access, Reversal, Rectification and Deletion
80.control_description: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to enable data subjects to request access to, modification, or deletion of their personal data, according to any applicable laws and regulations.

81.title: Limitation of Purpose in Personal Data Processing
81.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to ensure that personal data is processed according to any applicable laws and regulations and for the purposes declared to the data subject.

82.title: Personal Data Sub-processing
82.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the transfer and sub-processing of personal data within the service supply chain, according to any applicable laws and regulations.

83.title: Disclosure of Data Sub-processors
83.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to disclose the details of any personal or sensitive data access by sub-processors to the data owner prior to initiation of that processing.

84.title: Limitation of Production Data Use
84.control_description: Obtain authorization from data owners, and manage associated risk before replicating or using production data in non-production environments.

85.title: Data Retention and Deletion
85.control_description: Data retention, archiving and deletion is managed in accordance with business requirements, applicable laws and regulations.

86.title: Sensitive Data Protection
86.control_description: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to protect sensitive data throughout it's lifecycle.

87.title: Disclosure Notification
87.control_description: The CSP must have in place, and describe to CSCs the procedure to manage and respond to requests for disclosure of Personal Data by Law Enforcement Authorities according to applicable laws and regulations. The CSP must give special attention to the notification procedure to interested CSCs, unless otherwise prohibited, such as a prohibition under criminal law to preserve confidentiality of a law enforcement investigation.

88.title: Data Location
88.control_description: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to specify and document the physical locations of data, including any locations in which data is processed or backed up.

89.title: Governance Program Policy and Procedures
89.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for an information governance program, which is sponsored by the leadership of the organization. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

90.title: Risk Management Program
90.control_description: Establish a formal, documented, and leadership-sponsored Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) program that includes policies and procedures for identification, evaluation, ownership, treatment, and acceptance of cloud security and privacy risks.

91.title: Organizational Policy Reviews
91.control_description: Review all relevant organizational policies and associated procedures at least annually or when a substantial change occurs within the organization.

92.title: Policy Exception Process
92.control_description: Establish and follow an approved exception process as mandated by the governance program whenever a deviation from an established policy occurs.

93.title: Information Security Program
93.control_description: Develop and implement an Information Security Program, which includes programs for all the relevant domains of the CCM.

94.title: Governance Responsibility Model
94.control_description: Define and document roles and responsibilities for planning, implementing, operating, assessing, and improving governance programs.

95.title: Information System Regulatory Mapping
95.control_description: Identify and document all relevant standards, regulations, legal/contractual, and statutory requirements, which are applicable to your organization.

96.title: Special Interest Groups
96.control_description: Establish and maintain contact with cloud-related special interest groups and other relevant entities in line with business context.

97.title: Background Screening Policy and Procedures
97.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for background verification of all new employees (including but not limited to remote employees, contractors, and third parties) according to local laws, regulations, ethics, and contractual constraints and proportional to the data classification to be accessed, the business requirements, and acceptable risk. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

98.title: Acceptable Use of Technology Policy and Procedures
98.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for defining allowances and conditions for the acceptable use of organizationally-owned or managed assets. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

99.title: Clean Desk Policy and Procedures
99.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures that require unattended workspaces to not have openly visible confidential data. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

100.title: Remote and Home Working Policy and Procedures
100.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures to protect information accessed, processed or stored at remote sites and locations. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

101.title: Asset returns
101.control_description: Establish and document procedures for the return of organization-owned assets by terminated employees.

102.title: Employment Termination
102.control_description: Establish, document, and communicate to all personnel the procedures outlining the roles and responsibilities concerning changes in employment.

103.title: Employment Agreement Process
103.control_description: Employees sign the employee agreement prior to being granted access to organizational information systems, resources and assets.

104.title: Employment Agreement Content
104.control_description: The organization includes within the employment agreements provisions and/or terms for adherence to established information governance and security policies.

105.title: Personnel Roles and Responsibilities
105.control_description: Document and communicate roles and responsibilities of employees, as they relate to information assets and security.

106.title: Non-Disclosure Agreements
106.control_description: Identify, document, and review, at planned intervals, requirements for non-disclosure/confidentiality agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of data and operational details.

107.title: Security Awareness Training
107.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain a security awareness training program for all employees of the organization and provide regular training updates.

108.title: Personal and Sensitive Data Awareness and Training
108.control_description: Provide all employees with access to sensitive organizational and personal data with appropriate security awareness training and regular updates in organizational procedures, processes, and policies relating to their professional function relative to the organization.

109.title: Compliance User Responsibility
109.control_description: Make employees aware of their roles and responsibilities for maintaining awareness and compliance with established policies and procedures and applicable legal, statutory, or regulatory compliance obligations.

110.title: Identity and Access Management Policy and Procedures
110.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, implement, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for identity and access management. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

111.title: Strong Password Policy and Procedures
111.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, implement, apply, evaluate and maintain strong password policies and procedures. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

112.title: Identity Inventory
112.control_description: Manage, store, and review the information of system identities, and level of access.

113.title: Separation of Duties
113.control_description: Employ the separation of duties principle when implementing information system access.

114.title: Least Privilege
114.control_description: Employ the least privilege principle when implementing information system access.

115.title: User Access Provisioning
115.control_description: Define and implement a user access provisioning process which authorizes, records, and communicates access changes to data and assets.

116.title: User Access Changes and Revocation
116.control_description: De-provision or respectively modify access of movers / leavers or system identity changes in a timely manner in order to effectively adopt and communicate identity and access management policies.

117.title: User Access Review
117.control_description: Review and revalidate user access for least privilege and separation of duties with a frequency that is commensurate with organizational risk tolerance.

118.title: Segregation of Privileged Access Roles
118.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the segregation of privileged access roles such that administrative access to data, encryption and key management capabilities and logging capabilities are distinct and separated.

119.title: Management of Privileged Access Roles
119.control_description: Define and implement an access process to ensure privileged access roles and rights are granted for a time limited period, and implement procedures to prevent the culmination of segregated privileged access.

120.title: CSCs Approval for Agreed Privileged Access Roles
120.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes and procedures for customers to participate, where applicable, in the granting of access for agreed, high risk (as defined by the organizational risk assessment) privileged access roles.

121.title: Safeguard Logs Integrity
121.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to ensure the logging infrastructure is read-only for all with write access, including privileged access roles, and that the ability to disable it is controlled through a procedure that ensures the segregation of duties and break glass procedures.

122.title: Uniquely Identifiable Users
122.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures that ensure users are identifiable through unique IDs or which can associate individuals to the usage of user IDs.

123.title: Strong Authentication
123.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for authenticating access to systems, application and data assets, including multifactor authentication for at least privileged user and sensitive data access. Adopt digital certificates or alternatives which achieve an equivalent level of security for system identities.

124.title: Passwords Management
124.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the secure management of passwords.

125.title: Authorization Mechanisms
125.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to verify access to data and system functions is authorized.

126.title: Interoperability and Portability Policy and Procedures
126.control_description:
Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for interoperability and portability including requirements for:
a. Communications between application interfaces
b. Information processing interoperability
c. Application development portability
d. Information/Data exchange, usage, portability, integrity, and persistence
Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

127.title: Application Interface Availability
127.control_description: Provide application interface(s) to CSCs so that they programmatically retrieve their data to enable interoperability and portability.

128.title: Secure Interoperability and Portability Management
128.control_description: Implement cryptographically secure and standardized network protocols for the management, import and export of data.

129.title: Data Portability Contractual Obligations
129.control_description:
Agreements must include provisions specifying CSCs access to data upon contract termination and will include:
a. Data format
b. Length of time the data will be stored
c. Scope of the data retained and made available to the CSCs
d. Data deletion policy

130.title: Infrastructure and Virtualization Security Policy and Procedures
130.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for infrastructure and virtualization security. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

131.title: Capacity and Resource Planning
131.control_description: Plan and monitor the availability, quality, and adequate capacity of resources in order to deliver the required system performance as determined by the business.

132.title: Network Security
132.control_description: Monitor, encrypt and restrict communications between environments to only authenticated and authorized connections, as justified by the business. Review these configurations at least annually, and support them by a documented justification of all allowed services, protocols, ports, and compensating controls.

133.title: OS Hardening and Base Controls
133.control_description: Harden host and guest OS, hypervisor or infrastructure control plane according to their respective best practices, and supported by technical controls, as part of a security baseline.

135.title: Segmentation and Segregation
135.control_description: Design, develop, deploy and configure applications and infrastructures such that CSP and CSC (tenant) user access and intra-tenant access is appropriately segmented and segregated, monitored and restricted from other tenants.

136.title: Migration to Cloud Environments
136.control_description: Use secure and encrypted communication channels when migrating servers, services, applications, or data to cloud environments. Such channels must include only up-to-date and approved protocols.

138.title: Network Defense
138.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and defense-in-depth techniques for protection, detection, and timely response to network-based attacks.

139.title: Logging and Monitoring Policy and Procedures
139.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for logging and monitoring. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

140.title: Audit Logs Protection
140.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to ensure the security and retention of audit logs.

141.title: Security Monitoring and Alerting
141.control_description: Identify and monitor security-related events within applications and the underlying infrastructure. Define and implement a system to generate alerts to responsible stakeholders based on such events and corresponding metrics.

142.title: Audit Logs Access and Accountability
142.control_description: Restrict audit logs access to authorized personnel and maintain records that provide unique access accountability.

143.title: Audit Logs Monitoring and Response
143.control_description: Monitor security audit logs to detect activity outside of typical or expected patterns. Establish and follow a defined process to review and take appropriate and timely actions on detected anomalies.

144.title: Clock Synchronization
144.control_description: Use a reliable time source across all relevant information processing systems.

145.title: Logging Scope
145.control_description: Establish, document and implement which information meta/data system events should be logged. Review and update the scope at least annually or whenever there is a change in the threat environment.

146.title: Log Records
146.control_description: Generate audit records containing relevant security information.

147.title: Log Protection
147.control_description: The information system protects audit records from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

148.title: Encryption Monitoring and Reporting
148.control_description: Establish and maintain a monitoring and internal reporting capability over the operations of cryptographic, encryption and key management policies, processes, procedures, and controls.

149.title: Transaction/Activity Logging
149.control_description: Log and monitor key lifecycle management events to enable auditing and reporting on usage of cryptographic keys.

150.title: Access Control Logs
150.control_description: Monitor and log physical access using an auditable access control system.

151.title: Failures and Anomalies Reporting
151.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the reporting of anomalies and failures of the monitoring system and provide immediate notification to the accountable party.

152.domain: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics
152.title: Security Incident Management Policy and Procedures
152.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, and Cloud Forensics. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

153.domain: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics
153.title: Service Management Policy and Procedures
153.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for the timely management of security incidents. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

154.domain: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics
154.title: Incident Response Plans
154.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain a security incident response plan, which includes but is not limited to: relevant internal departments, impacted CSCs, and other business critical relationships (such as supply-chain) that may be impacted.

155.domain: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics
155.title: Incident Response Testing
155.control_description: Test and update as necessary incident response plans at planned intervals or upon significant organizational or environmental changes for effectiveness.

156.domain: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics
156.title: Incident Response Metrics
156.control_description: Establish and monitor information security incident metrics.

157.domain: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics
157.title: Event Triage Processes
157.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures supporting business processes to triage security-related events.

158.domain: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics
158.title: Security Breach Notification
158.control_description: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures for security breach notifications. Report security breaches and assumed security breaches including any relevant supply chain breaches, as per applicable SLAs, laws and regulations.

159.domain: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics
159.title: Points of Contact Maintenance
159.control_description: Maintain points of contact for applicable regulation authorities, national and local law enforcement, and other legal jurisdictional authorities.

160.title: SSRM Policy and Procedures
160.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for the application of the Shared Security Responsibility Model (SSRM) within the organization. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

161.title: SSRM Supply Chain
161.control_description: Apply, document, implement and manage the SSRM throughout the supply chain for the cloud service offering.

162.title: SSRM Guidance
162.control_description: Provide SSRM Guidance to the CSC detailing information about the SSRM applicability throughout the supply chain.

163.title: SSRM Control Ownership
163.control_description: Delineate the shared ownership and applicability of all CSA CCM controls according to the SSRM for the cloud service offering.

164.title: SSRM Documentation Review
164.control_description: Review and validate SSRM documentation for all cloud services offerings the organization uses.

165.title: SSRM Control Implementation
165.control_description: Implement, operate, and audit or assess the portions of the SSRM which the organization is responsible for.

166.title: Supply Chain Inventory
166.control_description: Develop and maintain an inventory of all supply chain relationships.

167.title: Supply Chain Risk Management
167.control_description: CSPs periodically review risk factors associated with all organizations within their supply chain.

168.title: Primary Service and Contractual Agreement
168.control_description:
Service agreements between CSPs and CSCs (tenants) must incorporate at least the following mutually-agreed upon provisions and/or terms:
 Scope, characteristics and location of business relationship and services offered
 Information security requirements (including SSRM)
 Change management process
 Logging and monitoring capability
 Incident management and communication procedures
 Right to audit and third party assessment
 Service termination
 Interoperability and portability requirements
 Data privacy

169.title: Supply Chain Agreement Review
169.control_description: Review supply chain agreements between CSPs and CSCs at least annually.

170.title: Internal Compliance Testing
170.control_description: Define and implement a process for conducting internal assessments to confirm conformance and effectiveness of standards, policies, procedures, and service level agreement activities at least annually.

171.title: Supply Chain Service Agreement Compliance
171.control_description: Implement policies requiring all CSPs throughout the supply chain to comply with information security, confidentiality, access control, privacy, audit, personnel policy and service level requirements and standards.

172.title: Supply Chain Governance Review
172.control_description: Periodically review the organization's supply chain partners' IT governance policies and procedures.

173.title: Supply Chain Data Security Assessment
173.control_description: Define and implement a process for conducting security assessments periodically for all organizations within the supply chain.

174.title: Threat and Vulnerability Management Policy and Procedures
174.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures to identify, report and prioritize the remediation of vulnerabilities, in order to protect systems against vulnerability exploitation. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

175.title: Malware Protection Policy and Procedures
175.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures to protect against malware on managed assets. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

176.title: Vulnerability Remediation Schedule
176.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to enable both scheduled and emergency responses to vulnerability identifications, based on the identified risk.

177.title: Detection Updates
177.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to update detection tools, threat signatures, and indicators of compromise on a weekly, or more frequent basis.

178.title: External Library Vulnerabilities
178.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to identify updates for applications which use third party or open source libraries according to the organization's vulnerability management policy.

179.title: Penetration Testing
179.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the periodic performance of penetration testing by independent third parties.

180.title: Vulnerability Identification
180.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the detection of vulnerabilities on organizationally managed assets at least monthly.

181.title: Vulnerability Prioritization
181.control_description: Use a risk-based model for effective prioritization of vulnerability remediation using an industry recognized framework.

182.title: Vulnerability Management Reporting
182.control_description: Define and implement a process for tracking and reporting vulnerability identification and remediation activities that includes stakeholder notification.

183.title: Vulnerability Management Metrics
183.control_description: Establish, monitor and report metrics for vulnerability identification and remediation at defined intervals.

184.title: Endpoint Devices Policy and Procedures
184.control_description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for all endpoints. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.

185.title: Application and Service Approval
185.control_description: Define, document, apply and evaluate a list of approved services, applications and sources of applications (stores) acceptable for use by endpoints when accessing or storing organization-managed data.

186.title: Compatibility
186.control_description: Define and implement a process for the validation of the endpoint device's compatibility with operating systems and applications.

187.title: Endpoint Inventory
187.control_description: Maintain an inventory of all endpoints used to store and access company data.

188.title: Endpoint Management
188.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to enforce policies and controls for all endpoints permitted to access systems and/or store, transmit, or process organizational data.

189.title: Automatic Lock Screen
189.control_description: Configure all relevant interactive-use endpoints to require an automatic lock screen.

190.title: Operating Systems
190.control_description: Manage changes to endpoint operating systems, patch levels, and/or applications through the company's change management processes.

191.title: Storage Encryption
191.control_description: Protect information from unauthorized disclosure on managed endpoint devices with storage encryption.

192.title: Anti-Malware Detection and Prevention
192.control_description: Configure managed endpoints with anti-malware detection and prevention technology and services.

193.title: Software Firewall
193.control_description: Configure managed endpoints with properly configured software firewalls.

194.title: Data Loss Prevention
194.control_description: Configure managed endpoints with Data Loss Prevention (DLP) technologies and rules in accordance with a risk assessment.

195.title: Remote Locate
195.control_description: Enable remote geo-location capabilities for all managed mobile endpoints.

196.title: Remote Wipe
196.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to enable the deletion of company data remotely on managed endpoint devices.

197.title: Third-Party Endpoint Security Posture
197.control_description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical and/or contractual measures to maintain proper security of third-party endpoints with access to organizational assets.
